content.question: A parallel plate capacitor with plate area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> and plate separation <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> has a surface charge density of magnitude <math alttext="sigma" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>σ</mi></mstyle></math> on each plate. Which of the following is the correct expression for the electric potential energy stored in the capacitor?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator sigma squared times A, and denominator 2 times epsilon sub 0, end sub, d squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>A</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator sigma squared, times A d, and denominator 2 epsilon sub 0, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>A</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator sigma squared, times A d, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>A</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator epsilon sub 0, end sub, times sigma squared, times A d, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>A</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator sigma squared, times A d, and denominator 2 epsilon sub 0, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>A</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>
